message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper proposes a novel loss layer for semantic image segmentation tasks using Deep Neural Networks. The paper focuses on improving the discriminative capabilities of the network by considering spatial layouts and interactions between neighboring pixels with the same object category. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a locally adaptive learning estimator, which involves training the network to be more sensitive to regional connections between adjacent pixels based on their categories. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also involves the use of Deep Neural Networks, which suggests that it may belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper focuses on semantic image segmentation, which suggests that it may also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
